segment.source: Description: You can view all of the names that you've reserved for your app, reserve additional names here, and delete names you don't need from the Manage app names page in the App management section for each of your apps in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: Description: You can view all of the names that you've reserved for your app, reserve additional names here, and delete names you don't need from the Manage app names page in the App management section for each of your apps in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: title: Manage app names
segment.target: title: Manage app names

segment.source: Manage app names
segment.target: Manage app names

segment.source: You can view all of the names that you've reserved for your app, reserve additional names here, and delete names you don't need from the Manage app names page in the App management section for each of your apps in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: You can view all of the names that you've reserved for your app, reserve additional names here, and delete names you don't need from the Manage app names page in the App management section for each of your apps in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: Reserve additional names for your app
segment.target: Reserve additional names for your app

segment.source: You can reserve multiple app names to use for the same app.
segment.target: You can reserve multiple app names to use for the same app.

segment.source: This is especially useful if you are offering your app in multiple languages and want to use different names for different languages.
segment.target: This is especially useful if you are offering your app in multiple languages and want to use different names for different languages.

segment.source: You can also use this to change the name of an app which you haven't published yet.
segment.target: You can also use this to change the name of an app which you haven't published yet.

segment.source: In the Reserve more names section of the Manage app names page, you'll see a text box.
segment.target: In the Reserve more names section of the Manage app names page, you'll see a text box.

segment.source: Enter the name you'd like to reserve, then click Check availability.
segment.target: Enter the name you'd like to reserve, then click Check availability.

segment.source: If the name is available, click Reserve name.
segment.target: If the name is available, click Reserve name.

segment.source: Note For more info about reserving app names, and why a certain name may not be available, see Create your app by reserving a name.
segment.target: Note For more info about reserving app names, and why a certain name may not be available, see Create your app by reserving a name.

segment.source: You can continue reserving additional app names here if desired.
segment.target: You can continue reserving additional app names here if desired.

segment.source: Delete app names
segment.target: Delete app names

segment.source: If you no longer want to use a name you've previously reserved, you can release it by deleting it here.
segment.target: If you no longer want to use a name you've previously reserved, you can release it by deleting it here.

segment.source: Make sure you're certain before you do so, since this means that the name will immediately become available for someone else to reserve and use.
segment.target: Make sure you're certain before you do so, since this means that the name will immediately become available for someone else to reserve and use.

segment.source: To delete one of your app's reserved names, find the name you no longer want to use and then click Delete.
segment.target: To delete one of your app's reserved names, find the name you no longer want to use and then click Delete.

segment.source: In the confirmation dialog, click Delete again to confirm.
segment.target: In the confirmation dialog, click Delete again to confirm.

segment.source: Note that your app needs to have at least one reserved name.
segment.target: Note that your app needs to have at least one reserved name.

segment.source: To completely remove an app from your dashboard (which also release all of the you've reserved for that app), you can click Delete this app from its Overview page.
segment.target: To completely remove an app from your dashboard (which also release all of the you've reserved for that app), you can click Delete this app from its Overview page.

segment.source: Rename an app that has already been published
segment.target: Rename an app that has already been published

segment.source: If your app is already in the Windows Store and you want to rename it, you can do so by reserving a new name for it (by following the steps described above) and then creating a new submission for the app.
segment.target: If your app is already in the Windows Store and you want to rename it, you can do so by reserving a new name for it (by following the steps described above) and then creating a new submission for the app.

segment.source: Note that you'll have to update your package to include the new name in order for the Store to display the app under the new name.
segment.target: Note that you'll have to update your package to include the new name in order for the Store to display the app under the new name.

segment.source: Be sure to use the new name in the Package/Properties/DisplayName element in the app manifest, and update any graphics or text that includes the app's name.
segment.target: Be sure to use the new name in the Package/Properties/DisplayName element in the app manifest, and update any graphics or text that includes the app's name.

segment.source: You'll also want to review your app's description and change the name if you mention it anywhere there.
segment.target: You'll also want to review your app's description and change the name if you mention it anywhere there.

segment.source: Once your app has been published with the new name, you can delete the old name that you no longer need to use.
segment.target: Once your app has been published with the new name, you can delete the old name that you no longer need to use.
